intro: Olearia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf daisy bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and strong winds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Olearia cuneifolia is also important in traditional Māori culture and has been used for various purposes.
